description: From hecto- (“hundred”) +‎ -graph, so called because it would make about 100 copies.

entries.meaning: (historical) An old printing machine that involves transfer of an original, prepared with special inks, to a pan of gelatin or a gelatin pad pulled tight on a metal frame.

verbs.description: hectograph (third-person singular simple present hectographs, present participle hectographing, simple past and past participle hectographed)

entries.meaning: To duplicate (a document) by this process.
